meanings.definition: To detain in conversation by or as if by holding on to the outer garments of
meanings.sent1: She buttonholed me after class to ask about the homework.
meanings.sent2: He buttonholed his friend at the party to talk about their favorite TV show.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, he buttonholed everyone with his long stories.
meanings.sent4: She buttonholed me with questions like a detective interrogating a suspect.
meanings.sent5: The salesman buttonholed every customer who walked into the store.

meanings.sent1: She buttonholed the fabric carefully before sewing the button.
meanings.sent2: He buttonholed his shirt to attach a flower for the party.
meanings.sent3: The tailor buttonholed the jacket with precision, ensuring a perfect fit.
meanings.sent4: She buttonholed the dress, adding a touch of elegance with a decorative button.
meanings.sent5: He buttonholed the coat, creating a functional buttonhole for the closure.
